title: King Day Virtual Talk: (In)Justice
hero_caption: Andy Warhol. Little Race Riot (detail), 1964. Gift of Edlis Neeson Collection. © 2018 The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc. / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York.
short_description: This participatory experience, inspired by the museum's collection and Martin Luther King Jr.'s "Letter from Birmingham Jail," will explore the many meanings of justice, resistance, and faith.
list_description: This participatory experience, inspired by the museum's collection and Martin Luther King Jr.'s "Letter from Birmingham Jail," will explore the many meanings of justice, resistance, and faith.
description:
This participatory experience, inspired by the museum's collection and Martin Luther King Jr.'s "Letter from Birmingham Jail," will explore the many meanings of justice, resistance, and faith.

Read Martin Luther King Jr.'s "Letter from Birmingham Jail" here. 

This program is part of the Art Institute’s King Day celebration—explore all King Day events and resources here.

This virtual event will be hosted on Zoom. Find Zoom tutorials and resources here. If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.
